definition: noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important

sentences.english: He didn't pretend to be aloof to despise the girl in whorehouse .
sentences.chinese: 他也不會故做清高，拾青樓女子於不顧。

sentences.english: Always thought that to understand a lot of their own, chat all day, pretend to be thou.
sentences.chinese: 總以爲自己懂很多，整天談天說地，自命清高。

sentences.english: His loftiness sends him into despair when deprived of his job.
sentences.chinese: 他的自命清高使他在下崗後陷入絕望的境地。

sentences.english: High-minded young people also want to work for companies with a decent ethical reputation.
sentences.chinese: 清高的年輕人也希望能進入名企工作。

sentences.english: When such a lady-killer is after you, don't play too much hardball.
sentences.chinese: 像他這樣的美女殺手都追你，就不要太清高了。

sentences.english: Men of Yiliao are high-hearted guys who look down on the people like us.
sentences.chinese: 像市南宜僚這樣清高的人，他們是瞧不起我輩人士的。

sentences.english: O if thy pride did not our joys controul.
sentences.chinese: 哦，倘若你的清高未把歡樂阻礙。

sentences.english: Outsider, she alienated a low-key, lofty, persist in one's old ways.
sentences.chinese: 外人眼裏，她疏離低調，冷傲清高，我行我素。

sentences.english: I will not remain aloof and indifferent when you pet me.
sentences.chinese: 我不會在您撫愛我時顯得清高和冷漠。

sentences.english: Once more think this is a Qing Lian, in the loneliness of the fragrance of its own obligation to remain aloof.
sentences.chinese: 曾，多想是一朵清蓮，在寂寞的馨香中獨自清高。

sentences.english: Our response to profanity and unacceptable speech should not be an occasion for self-righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 我們在對粗俗話語的反應不可自命清高。

definition: to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
